ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 171
ygData.msgSnippet: ... A BLW and DD only have a half second difference in attack speed.  Over a one minute battle, the DD will only attack 5 more times than a BLW if wielded in
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 12 Jul 1999, CMai wrote:
>
> I have not scientifically tested this out yet but from last night, using a
> thulian claw as the primary it seems that I get the same amount of dual
> wield as I did from a dragoon dirk to a barbed whip. A lot more dmg too.
> So I think the secondary does not matter.

A BLW and DD only have a half second difference in attack
speed. Over a one minute battle, the DD will only attack 5
more times than a BLW if wielded in the primary. If wielded
in the secondary and a 20% chance to dual wield (roughly L20),
the DD would only attack one more time than the BLW on average
over a minute. It'd be easy to fail to notice that
difference.

If you want to really test it, try a DD vs a minotaur axe.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
